item.title: 美国期货和美元因特朗普的美联储回调而上涨：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示无意解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔，贸易紧张局势可能缓和的乐观情绪升温，美国股指期货大涨，美元走强。【原文：US equity futures surged and the dollar strengthened after President Donald Trump said he had no intention of firing Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell and as optimism grew that trade tensions may be easing.】

item.title: 欧盟讨论俄罗斯天然气逐步退出的现货市场目标
item.description: 作为逐步停止从俄罗斯进口能源计划的一部分，欧盟正准备讨论禁止从俄罗斯现货采购天然气的想法。【原文：The European Union is preparing to discuss the idea of a ban on spot purchases of natural gas from Russia as part of a plan to phase out energy imports from the country.】

item.title: 特朗普对鲍威尔的言论降温，美元止跌反弹
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示无意解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔之后，美元兑主要货币走高。【原文：The dollar advanced against its major peers after US President Donald Trump said he had no intention of firing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 特朗普压制鲍威尔的批评后美国股指期货上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示无意解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔，也不会在与中国的任何贸易谈判中采取强硬立场，此后美国股指期货走高。【原文：US stock futures advanced after President Donald Trump said he had no intention of firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and he would not strike a hard line in any trade talks with China.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯和印度同意建立两座炼油厂
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯和印度同意深化能源关系，并在旅游和技术等领域寻求更紧密的合作，因为两国在全球经济动荡之际寻求加强关系。【原文：Saudi Arabia and India agreed to deepen energy ties and pursue closer cooperation in areas like tourism and technology as the countries seek to strengthen relations at a time of turbulence for the global economy.】

item.title: 在中国的后院，越南钢铁买家正努力遏制廉价金属浪潮
item.description:
世界两大经济体之间的贸易战让这个东南亚国家陷入困境。【原文：

A trade war between the world’s two largest economies has caught this Southeast Asian nation in the crossfire.

】

item.title: 特朗普关税谈判影响印尼盾，印尼将维持利率不变
item.description: 印尼央行可能会维持基准利率稳定，以稳定因美国关税及其对国内经济影响的不确定性而受到严重拖累的货币。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank is likely to hold its benchmark interest rate steady to stabilize a currency heavily weighed down by uncertainty over US tariffs and their impact on the domestic economy.】

item.title: 中国外债销售额占新兴市场总额的比例创历史新高
item.description: 中国企业和政府借款人推动了美元和欧元债券的发行，使其在本月新兴市场所有此类债券销售中所占比例达到创纪录水平，这是抵御贸易战的一个迹象。【原文：Chinese corporate and government borrowers have pushed issuance of dollar and euro bonds to a record proportion of all such note sales in emerging markets this month, in one sign of resilience to the trade war.】

item.title: 美联储库格勒称关税影响可能大于预期
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒说，关税可能会给价格带来上涨压力，对经济的影响也会比之前预期的要大。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said tariffs will likely put upward pressure on prices and have a bigger economic effect than previously expected.】

item.title: 距离加拿大大选还有六天，卡尼领导的自由党以微弱优势领先
item.description: 在距离加拿大大选日不到一周的时间里，马克-卡尼领导的自由党在民意调查中以微弱优势保持领先，因为美国的关税威胁仍然是竞选活动中的首要问题。【原文：Mark Carney’s Liberal Party is holding on to a narrow lead in opinion surveys with less than a week to go before Canada’s election day, as US tariff threats remain a top issue in the campaign.】

item.title: 特朗普称无意解雇美联储主席鲍威尔
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，尽管他对美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔没有更快地采取行动降低利率感到不满，但他无意解雇美联储主席鲍威尔。【原文：President Donald Trump said he had no intention of firing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell despite his frustration with the central bank not moving more quickly to slash interest rates.】

item.title: 自金融危机以来，首席执行官们从未如此悲观地看待美国经济
item.description: 自金融危机以来，美国企业从未在财报电话会议上对经济状况如此悲观，这对投资者来说是一个不祥之兆，他们正试图弄清唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战会给股市带来多大的痛苦。【原文：Not since the financial crisis has Corporate America been so downbeat about the state of the economy in earnings calls, an ominous sign for investors trying to figure out how much more pain Donald Trump’s trade war will inflict on the stock market.】

item.title: Exelon 首席执行官称清洁不再是公用事业公司的首要任务
item.description: Exelon Corp. 首席执行官 Calvin Butler 表示，随着电力公司竞相满足人工智能带来的日益增长的电力需求，它们的工作重点正从清洁能源和可持续发展转移开来。首席执行官卡尔文-巴特勒（Calvin Butler）表示。【原文：The focus of power companies is shifting away from clean energy and sustainability as they race to meet growing power demand from artificial intelligence, according to Exelon Corp. Chief Executive Officer Calvin Butler.】

item.title: 里夫斯将在华盛顿贝森特会议上呼吁美国达成协议
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将于本周在华盛顿亲自向美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）呼吁达成贸易协议，旨在 "捍卫英国利益 "并确保关税优惠待遇。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will make a personal appeal for a trade deal to US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent in Washington this week, aiming to “defend British interests” and secure preferential treatment on tariffs.】

item.title: 在竞争对手努班克的合约结束后，MercadoLibre 向流行偶像阿妮塔抛出橄榄枝
item.description: MercadoLibre 公司的金融部门 Mercado Pago 发起了一场新的宣传活动，以新产品、全新的品牌形象和曾为其竞争对手工作的名人代言人吸引巴西的客户。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc.’s financial unit Mercado Pago launched a new campaign to lure customers in Brazil with a new product, revamped branding and a celebrity spokesperson who used to work for its rival.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔金认为经济稳定，信心不足令人担忧
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）表示，美国经济形势依然良好，但企业投资和消费者支出前景堪忧。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said the US economy remained in good shape, but that trouble loomed in the outlook for business investment and consumer spending.】

item.title: Clearlake 支持的 Ivanti 与部分贷款人达成债务协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由 Clearlake Capital Group 支持的 Ivanti 软件公司已与其核心贷款人集团达成协议，将为该公司提供新的融资并延长现有到期日。【原文：Clearlake Capital Group-backed Ivanti Software Inc. has reached a deal with a core group of its lenders that gives it fresh financing and an extension of existing maturities, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 国债期权显示 2021 年 "闪电崩盘 "以来最大担忧
item.description: 对美国资产日益增长的不安情绪引发了长期政府债券的抛售，并导致收益率飙升，这种不安情绪正在期权市场上显现出来，期权市场上防止更大损失的溢价达到了自2021年 "闪电崩盘 "以来的最高点。【原文：The growing unease around US assets that has sparked a selloff in long-term government bonds and sent yields soaring is showing up in the options market, where premiums to protect against even bigger losses are at their highest since the “flash crash” of 2021.】

item.title: 信用卡消费增长，Capital One 利润攀升 10
item.description: 即将收购竞争对手发现金融服务公司（Discover Financial Services）的 Capital One 金融公司公布的第一季度利润增加，原因是消费者的信用卡消费增加。【原文：Capital One Financial Corp., the lender set to acquire rival Discover Financial Services, posted higher first-quarter profit as consumers spent more on credit cards.】

item.title: SAP利润超预期，云计算收入却不尽如人意
item.description: SAP SE 第一季度利润超过分析师预期，尽管其密切关注的云计算收入略低于预期。【原文：SAP SE’s first-quarter profit topped analysts’ estimates, even as its closely watched cloud revenue came in slightly below projections.】

item.title: 山姆-奥特曼将卸任核电初创公司 Oklo 董事长一职
item.description: 亿万富翁、OpenAI 公司联合创始人萨姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）将辞去先进核技术开发商 Oklo 公司董事长一职。山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）将辞去先进核技术开发商 Oklo 公司董事长一职，为两家公司未来的合作铺平道路。【原文：Billionaire and co-founder of OpenAI Inc. Sam Altman will relinquish his chairman role at advanced nuclear technology developer Oklo Inc., paving the way for the two companies to collaborate in the future.】

item.title: 特朗普对华关税将冲击为亚马逊和联邦快递提供服务的加州枢纽
item.description: 根据一项新的分析，唐纳德-特朗普总统对中国进口商品征收的关税有可能破坏南加州的贸易和物流经济，该行业运输着全国三分之一的集装箱货物，并支撑着近 200 万个工作岗位。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Chinese imports threaten to disrupt Southern California’s trade and logistics economy, a sector that moves a third of the nation’s container cargo and supports nearly 2 million jobs, according to a new analysis.】

item.title: 阿波罗、Blackstone 牵头为波音部门收购提供 40 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据熟悉该交易的人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Private credit firms led by Apollo Global Management Inc. and Blackstone Inc. are providing $4 billion in loans to support Thoma Bravo’s acquisition of Boeing Co.’s flight navigation unit and other digital assets, according to people familiar with the deal.】

item.title: 巴西卢拉表示不想在中美贸易战中做出选择
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）不想在美国和中国之间做出选择，因为全球最大的两个经济体之间不断升级的贸易战正迫使巴西这样的国家选择站在哪一边。【原文：Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has no desire to choose between the US and China as an escalating trade fight between the planet’s two largest economies pushes nations like his own to pick a side.】

item.title: 3.73 亿美元空头押注后，看跌 ETF 警报大作
item.description: 一群 ETF 交易员正在押注股市不会出现大幅反弹，因为他们要为空头头寸买单，并从看涨策略中撤出资金。【原文：A group of ETF traders are betting against a spirited rebound in the stock market, as they pay up for short positions and withdraw money from bullish strategies.】

item.title: 阿根廷 2 月份经济增长超出预期
item.description: 在哈维尔-米莱总统与国际货币基金组织达成 200 亿美元协议一周后，阿根廷 2 月份的经济增长超过预期，巩固了该国在哈维尔-米莱总统领导下的反弹势头。【原文：Argentina’s economy grew more than expected in February, solidifying the country’s bounceback under President Javier Milei a week after he clinched a $20 billion deal with the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 巴克莱首席执行官预计美元仍将是世界储备货币
item.description: 巴克莱银行首席执行官 C.S. Venkatakrishnan 表示，即使在特朗普政府的关税政策造成经济动荡的情况下，美元 "绝对 "仍将是全球唯一的储备货币。【原文：The US dollar will “absolutely” remain the world’s only reserve currency, Barclays Plc Chief Executive Officer C.S. Venkatakrishnan said, even amid economic upheaval created by the Trump administration’s tariff policies.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数反弹令交易员担心市场再次出现头部假象
item.description: 周二股市反弹，华尔街专业人士向急于重返股市的投资者发出警告：在长期下跌过程中，要谨防 "假摔"。【原文：Wall Street pros have a warning for investors eager to jump back into the stock market as it rebounds Tuesday: Watch out for headfakes in the middle of a longer-term decline.】

item.description:
